sources.data_found: 2022 Degree Completion Data: 34 Bachelor's degrees in Computer Science awarded; 12 Master's degrees in Computer Science awarded.

student_data.notes: Official live enrollment dashboards for AU are restricted. Counts are estimated based on latest verified IPEDS degree completion data (2022) available via DataUSA. Undergrad estimate: 34 degrees awarded × 4 years = 136. Grad (MS) estimate: 12 degrees awarded × 2 years = 24. No standalone CS PhD program exists at AU (department offers BS and MS only).

gpu_resources.notes: American University's primary cluster is 'Zorro'. Public documentation and research guides confirm the presence of 2 GPU nodes. Legacy specifications identify these as equipped with 4x NVIDIA V100 GPUs each (Total: 2 nodes × 4 GPUs = 8 V100s). No evidence of newer A100/H100 acquisitions in public procurement records or news releases. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

compute_credits.description: No public data found regarding cloud compute credits.

analysis_notes: American University is primarily a liberal arts and policy institution; its CS infrastructure is modest compared to R1 engineering schools. Student counts are estimated from degree awards due to lack of public enrollment manifests. GPU resources are based on the 'Zorro' cluster specs; newer hardware may exist in isolated labs but is not part of the central research computing shared facility.
